features: Ruled 3 x 5 index cards are the perfect study tool for students of all ages; ideal for flash cards, notes or to do list; 300 per pack
Classic 3x5 cards are a practical size for the whole household; ideal for elementary school flashcards or complex, higher level notes
Standard weight index cards support pencil, ink pens, gel pens or highlighters; use lots of color for focused, effective notes
Make Oxford index cards part of your strategy for better notetaking; studies suggest longhand notes help you process and recall info better
Stock up on 300 card packs in classic white; perfect for busy homeschool, traditional classroom or distance learning settings
body.description: Ampad® Engineering Computation Pads have 5 x 5 cross-section rulings printed on back and margin lines and heading bars on front. The format is ideal for architects, engineers and students producing diagrams or technical drawings. Each glue-top pad features low-glare green tinted paper and is 3-hole punched to fit a standard binder. Proudly made in the USA. 8-1/2" x 11". 100 sheets.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: 3 Clever Ways to Use Oxford Index Cards The ultimate study buddy, Oxford index cards can help you prep for tests, presentations and more. Whether you need blank, ruled or colorful options, we've got you covered. Organize your thoughts through a visual brainstorm, conduct a strategy planning session or plan a DIY home project—all with index cards. Take the stress out of moving with colorful index cards. Color code boxes for specific rooms and label the contents on each card.

Oxford White Index Cards Oxford Color Index Cards Oxford Spiral Index Cards Oxford Tabbed Index Card Guides Oxford Index Card Storage Boxes Key Features Perfect for flash cards, lists, presentations and more Elevate your study and presentation prep with color coding Spiral binding keeps index cards organized. Perforated edge for easy removal Find and sort index cards quickly with tabbed index card guides Organize, protect and store index cards and other small items Ruling Blank on both sides or, ruled on front, blank on back Blank on both sides or, ruled on front, blank on back Ruled on front, blank on back Sizes 3"x5"; 3"x2.5"; 4"x6"; 5"x8" 3"x5"; 3"x2.5"; 4"x6"; 5"x8" 3"x5"; 4"x6"; 5"x8" 3"x5"; 4"x6"; 5"x8" 3"x5"; 4"x6"; 5"x8"; 6"x9" Colors White Assorted Colors White and Assorted Colors Assorted Color Tabs and Dividers Fiberboard Box Available in Gray or Green Tabs Available in blank and pre-printed tabs (A-Z, 1-31, Jan.-Dec.) reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The Oxford Ruled Index Cards have been a lifesaver for my study routine! The 3" x 5" size is perfect for jotting down quick notes, creating flashcards, or organizing key information. The ruled lines add a neatness that I appreciate, keeping my writing straight and organized.The white color ensures my notes stand out, and the cards are of excellent quality. They are sturdy enough to withstand frequent handling and fit perfectly into my index card holder.Whether I'm preparing for exams or just need a quick reference tool, these index cards are my go-to. They're reliable, durable, and the lined format is a game-changer for maintaining clarity in my notes.In short, the Oxford Ruled Index Cards are an essential part of my study arsenal. Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very Thin Paper - Markers Bleed Through
reviews.reviewText: The cards are of good quality and uniform in size. Love the fact that they are made in the USA. The only shortcoming of the cards is the thickness. When using a marker to make notes on the cards, the markers bleeds through the card and can be seen on the opposite side. This makes the cards less usable as I wanted to use the marker to make bold and easy to read flash cards. I ended up using a ballpoint pen which could also be seen through the card (but usable)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just what i needed. Perfect.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for Studying
reviews.reviewText: My 8th grader uses these to help her study for her quizzes, exams, and finals. Great quality for the price. The 3 pack got us through the 1st quarter.

These index cards were a little thinner than I expected, but that turned out to be a good thing, because more fit in my card holder and it feels less wasteful than using really thick cards. Despite being thinner than cards I've used in the past, I haven't had a problem with them tearing or crumpling. The cards were all evenly printed, with no unusually pale or oddly angled lines.
Receive the packs in good condition and good quality.

I didn't check reviews before purchasing these because I did not think it was possible to stuff up something as simple as an index card. I mean, "card" is right there in the name, which would indicate it was card stock. These are barely thicker than standard paper. I would say it was a complete waste of money except that I now have several hundred pieces of scrap paper for my next 37 years worth of grocery lists and, the most valuable quality, I've learned never to assume what I'm buying on this website isn't a flaming pile of cheap garbage.

it’s an ok product. only one side of it is lined and some of the lines are a bit faded. could be worse. fine if you want flash cards so you write the term on the non lined side and then the definition on the lined side🤷🏼‍♂️. does the job. paper feels pretty thick and sturdy as well so not too too bad

reviews.reviewTitle: Terrible Quality. They're not CARDS but as thin as printer paper.
reviews.reviewText: I bought these to be used by children as flashcards - but they won't last 1 use. These are as thin as printer paper and have the card lines printed on them. If you need any form of stability in the card or they require frequent use - don't waste your time with these. Get the name brand, these are as thin as notebook paper. Processing a return on them.
